pull.title: Tiny refactor of `IsRBFOptIn`, avoid exception
pull.body: While working with RBF in the GUI, the exception in `IsRBFOptIn()` (throw std::runtime_error("Cannot determine RBF opt-in signal for non-mempool transaction\n")) could be unexpected.

events.body: Looks good, thanks for cleaning this up.  This code is tested in `listtransactions.py`, which passes on my machine, so ACK (assuming travis agrees).

events.body: Force push fixed the git commit message typo.

comments.body: Meh. Had that first, but the if/elseif uses less lines (just two conditions).
In this case, I think '?' operator is the best solution here... Isn't FINAL case missing here anyway?
I think the `?` operator does not fit well for a non-boolean. The `FINAL` case is handled by the default value set at L82.
